channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump factors big in Virginia's primaries today
item.description: An incumbent House Republican, Bob Good, faces a tough primary challenger — who is backed by Former President Donald Trump — after Good endorsed DeSantis in the GOP presidential primary.
item.content:encoded: An incumbent House Republican, Bob Good, faces a tough primary challenger — who is backed by Former President Donald Trump — after Good endorsed DeSantis in the GOP presidential primary.
item.dc:creator: Jahd Khalil

item.title: Boeing CEO faced sharp criticism from angry lawmakers on Capitol Hill
item.description: Senators grilled Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun Tuesday about the company's aircraft production issues. His appearance came the same day a new whistleblower raised fresh allegations about the 737 Max.
item.content:encoded: Senators grilled Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun Tuesday about the company's aircraft production issues. His appearance came the same day a new whistleblower raised fresh allegations about the 737 Max.
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Boston Celtics win — again
item.description: The Boston Celtics are world champions. Again. It's their 18th NBA title — the most in history. The Celtics dominated the series defeating the Dallas Mavericks 4-1.
item.content:encoded: The Boston Celtics are world champions. Again. It's their 18th NBA title — the most in history. The Celtics dominated the series defeating the Dallas Mavericks 4-1.
item.dc:creator: Esteban Bustillos

item.title: Control of Minnesota's legislature is on the line in a special election this fall
item.description: Democrats have a majority in the Minnesota legislature. But after a resignation and other potential departures, Republicans could assume control of the state senate, at least until Election Day.
item.content:encoded: Democrats have a majority in the Minnesota legislature. But after a resignation and other potential departures, Republicans could assume control of the state senate, at least until Election Day.
item.dc:creator: Dana Ferguson

item.title: President Marcos Jr. hasn't put an end to killings in the Philippines' drug war
item.description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marco Jr. said he would turn his predecessor's deadly campaign against drug users and sellers "bloodless." Yet extrajudicial killings continue.
item.content:encoded: Philippine President Ferdinand Marco Jr. said he would turn his predecessor's deadly campaign against drug users and sellers "bloodless." Yet extrajudicial killings continue.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Biden adviser talks shielding undocumented spouses of U.S. citizens from deportation
item.description: President Biden announced Tuesday new executive actions to protect an estimated half million undocumented spouses of U.S. citizens from being deported.
item.content:encoded: President Biden announced Tuesday new executive actions to protect an estimated half million undocumented spouses of U.S. citizens from being deported.
item.dc:creator: Gus Contreras

item.title: This database could help descendants of enslaved people learn about their ancestry
item.description: Ancestry.com has released a new free database of tens of thousands of old newspaper records about formerly enslaved people. The company hopes it will help fill historical gaps for Black Americans.
item.content:encoded: Ancestry.com has released a new free database of tens of thousands of old newspaper records about formerly enslaved people. The company hopes it will help fill historical gaps for Black Americans.
item.dc:creator: Gurjit Kaur

item.title: Chiquita is ordered to pay millions to families of death squad victims in Colombia
item.description: A landmark verdict orders Chiquita, one of the worlds largest banana companies, to pay millions of dollars in damages to the relatives of eight Colombian men murdered by a paramilitary death squad.
item.content:encoded: A landmark verdict orders Chiquita, one of the worlds largest banana companies, to pay millions of dollars in damages to the relatives of eight Colombian men murdered by a paramilitary death squad.
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: Petition pushes FEMA to classify extreme heat and wildfire smoke as 'major disasters'
item.description: Thirty environmental, healthcare and labor groups filed a petition urging federal government to include heat and wildfire smoke in its definition of “major disaster.”
item.content:encoded: Thirty environmental, healthcare and labor groups filed a petition urging federal government to include heat and wildfire smoke in its definition of “major disaster.”
item.dc:creator: Megan Lim

item.title: Russia's Putin Visits North Korea
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin makes a two-day state visit to North Korea meeting with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un. We explore how the two countries might cooperate, with NPR's correspondents in Moscow and Seoul.
item.content:encoded:
Russian President Vladimir Putin makes a two-day state visit to North Korea meeting with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un. We explore how the two countries might cooperate, with NPR's correspondents in Moscow and Seoul.

(Image credit: Vladimir Smirnov)
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes
